00018 typedef struct file_handle_struct {

00020   int fd;

00026   block_p current_block; 
00027 } file_handle_struct;

00088 static struct {

00096 static void put_fhandle_info ( pmsg_level level, fhandle_p fh )
00097 {
00098   if (fh == NULL)
00099     {
00100       put_msg (level, "NULL file handle\n");
00101       return;
00102     }
00103   put_msg (level, "  fname: \"%s\", fd: %d, ", fh->fname, fh->fd );
00104   append_msg (level, "%d blocks, current: %d.\n",
00105              fh->num_blocks, fh->current_block->blk_nr);
00106   put_msg(level, "   in memory: ");
00107   int i;
00108   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00109     if ( fh->blocks_in_mem[i] != NULL )
00110       append_msg (level,  " %d,", fh->blocks_in_mem[i]->blk_nr);
00111   append_msg (level,  "\n" );
00112 }

00115 static fhandle_p get_tbl_file ( const char *fname );

00117 void put_file_info ( pmsg_level level, const char *name )
00118 {
00119   fhandle_p fh = get_tbl_file (name);
00120   if ( fh == NULL )
00121     put_msg (level, "file \"%s\" not open.\n", name);
00122   else
00123     put_fhandle_info (level, fh);
00124 }
00125 
00126 void put_page_info ( pmsg_level level, page_p p )
00127 {
00128   if (p == NULL)
00129     {
00130       put_msg (level, "  NULL page\n");
00131       return;
00132     }
00133   if ( p-> block == NULL )
00134     {
00135       put_msg (level,  "  unused\n");
00136       return;
00137     }
00138   put_msg (level, "  current_pos: %d, ", p->current_pos);
00139   append_msg (level, "  free_pos: %d, ", p->free_pos);
00140         
00141   if (p->pinned == 0)
00142     append_msg (level,  "unpinned, ");
00143   else
00144     append_msg (level,  "pinned, ");
00145                 
00146   if (p->dirty == 0)
00147     append_msg (level,  "clean\n");
00148   else
00149     append_msg (level,  "dirty\n");     
00150                 
00151   put_block_info ( level, p->block );
00152 }
00153 
00154 void put_block_info ( pmsg_level level, block_p b )
00155 {
00156   if ( b == NULL )
00157     return;
00158   put_msg (level,  "    block: " );
00159   if ( b-> fhandle != NULL )
00160     append_msg (level, "file: %s, ", b->fhandle->fname);
00161   append_msg (level,  "blk_nr: %d, page_nr: %d\n", b->blk_nr, b->page->page_nr );
00162 }
00163 
00164 void put_pager_info (pmsg_level level,  const char *msg )
00165 {
00166   if ( msg == NULL)
00167     msg = "";
00168   put_msg (level,  "----Pager Info Begin----\n");
00169   put_msg (level,  "(%s)\n", msg);
00170   int i;
00171   put_msg (level, "file handlers:\n");
00172   for ( i = 0; i < MAX_OPEN_FILES; i++)
00173     if ( file_handles[i] != NULL )
00174       {
00175         put_msg (level,  " %d:\n", i);
00176         put_fhandle_info (level, file_handles[i]);
00177       }                 
00178         
00179   put_msg (level, "pages:\n");
00180   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00181     if ( pages[i] != NULL )
00182       {
00183         put_msg (level,  " page  %d:\n", i);
00184         put_page_info (level, pages[i]);
00185       }
00186 
00187   put_msg (level,  "----Pager Info End ----\n");
00188 }
00189 
00190 void put_pager_profiler_info (pmsg_level level )
00191 {
00192   put_msg (level, "Number of disk seeks/reads/writes/IOs: %d/%d/%d/%d\n",
00193            pager_profiler.num_seeks,
00194            pager_profiler.num_disk_reads,
00195            pager_profiler.num_disk_writes,
00196            pager_profiler.num_disk_reads + pager_profiler.num_disk_writes);
00197 }
00198 
00199 static void put_pqueue_info (pmsg_level level, pqueue_p q, char *which)
00200 {
00201   if (q == NULL)
00202     {
00203       put_msg (level, "Page LRF %s is NULL\n", which);
00204       return;
00205     }
00206   put_msg (level, "Page LRF %s, length %d:\n", which, q->len);
00207   pq_elm_p p = q->first;
00208   while (p != NULL)
00209     {
00210       append_msg (level, "  %d,", p->page->page_nr);
00211       if (p == q->last)
00212         {         
00213           p = NULL;
00214           break;
00215         }
00216       p = p->next;
00217     } 
00218   append_msg (level, "\n");
00219 }
00220 
00221 void put_pqueues_info (pmsg_level level)
00222 {
00223   put_pqueue_info (level, q_unpinned, "unpinned");
00224   put_pqueue_info (level, q_pinned, "pinned");
00225 }

00228 void pager_profiler_reset ( void )
00229 {
00230   pager_profiler.num_seeks = 0;
00231   pager_profiler.num_disk_reads = 0;
00232   pager_profiler.num_disk_writes = 0;
00233   pager_profiler.last_fd = -1;
00234   pager_profiler.last_blk_nr = -1;
00235 }
00236 
00237 int set_system_dir ( char *dir )
00238 {
00239   if ( dir == NULL ) return -1;
00240 
00241   pager_terminate ();
00242   if (chdir (dir) == -1)
00243     {
00244       if ((mkdir (dir, 0755) == -1) || (chdir (dir) == -1))
00245         {
00246           put_msg (ERROR, "%s - Invalid dir for database.\n", dir); 
00247           return -1;
00248         }
00249     }
00250   getcwd(sys_dir, sizeof(sys_dir));
00251   put_msg (DEBUG, "db dir : %s\n", sys_dir);
00252   pager_init ();
00253 
00254   return 0;
00255 }
00256 
00257 char* system_dir ()
00258 {
00259   return sys_dir;
00260 }

00264 static void inc_num_seeks_maybe ( int fd, int blk_nr )
00265 {
00266   /* put_msg (DEBUG, "seeks_maybe: fd %d, blk: %d\n", fd, blk_nr); */
00267   if (fd != pager_profiler.last_fd
00268       || abs(blk_nr - pager_profiler.last_blk_nr) > 1)
00269     pager_profiler.num_seeks++;
00270   pager_profiler.last_fd = fd;
00271   pager_profiler.last_blk_nr = blk_nr;
00272 }
00273 
00275 static void inc_num_reads (int fd, int blk_nr)
00276 {
00277   inc_num_seeks_maybe (fd, blk_nr);
00278   pager_profiler.num_disk_reads++;
00279 }
00280 
00282 static void inc_num_writes (int fd, int blk_nr)
00283 {
00284   inc_num_seeks_maybe (fd, blk_nr);
00285   pager_profiler.num_disk_writes++;
00286 }

00288 static int get_header_int_at ( page_p p, int offset )
00289 {
00290   if ( offset < 0 || offset >= PAGE_HEADER_SIZE -INT_SIZE)
00291     {
00292       put_msg (ERROR,
00293                "get_header_int_at: offset %d out of range (%ld,%ld)\n",
00294                offset, 0L, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE - INT_SIZE - 1 );
00295       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00296     }
00297   int res = (int) *((int *)((p->content) + offset));
00298   return res;
00299 }
00300 
00301 static int put_header_int_at ( page_p p, int offset, int val )
00302 {
00303   if ( offset < 0 || offset >= PAGE_HEADER_SIZE - INT_SIZE )
00304     {
00305       put_msg (ERROR, 
00306                "put_header_int_at: offset %d out of range (%ld,%ld)\n",
00307                offset, 0L, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE - INT_SIZE - 1 );
00308       return -1;
00309     }
00310   memcpy ( p->content + offset, (char *) &val, INT_SIZE );
00311   p->dirty = 1;
00312   return 0;
00313 }
00314 
00315 /* When putting and getting header values, make sure not to change
00316    the current position */
00317 static void init_page_header_size (page_p p)
00318 {
00319   put_header_int_at (p, 0, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE);
00320 }
00321 
00322 static void check_page_header_size (page_p p)
00323 {
00324   int header_size = get_header_int_at (p, 0);
00325   if (header_size != PAGE_HEADER_SIZE)
00326     {
00327       put_msg (FATAL,
00328                "Header size of block is %d, which is incompatible with %d of current system.\n",
00329                header_size, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE);
00330       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00331     }
00332 }
00333 
00334 static void set_page_free_pos (page_p p, int pos)
00335 {
00336   p->free_pos = pos;
00337   put_header_int_at (p, 4, pos);
00338 }
00339 
00340 static void set_page_free_pos_from_content (page_p p)
00341 {
00342   p->free_pos = get_header_int_at (p, 4);
00343 }
00344 
00345 static void init_page (page_p p, int page_nr)
00346 {       
00347   if ( p == NULL )
00348     return;
00349   p->page_nr = page_nr;
00350   init_page_header_size (p);
00351   set_page_free_pos (p, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE);
00352   p->qelm = NULL;
00353   p->block = NULL;
00354   p->pinned = 0;
00355   p->dirty = 0;
00356   p->current_pos = PAGE_HEADER_SIZE;
00357 }
00358 
00359 static page_p make_page (int page_nr)
00360 {
00361   page_p p = (page_p) malloc (sizeof (page_struct));
00362   if (p == NULL)
00363     put_msg (ERROR, "make_page failed");
00364   else
00365     init_page (p, page_nr);
00366   return p;
00367 }
00368 
00369 static pqueue_p make_pqueue ()
00370 {
00371   pqueue_p pq = (pqueue_p) malloc (sizeof (pqueue));
00372   pq->first = NULL;
00373   pq->last = NULL;
00374   pq->len = 0;
00375   return pq;
00376 }
00377 
00378 static pqueue_p release_pqueue (pqueue_p q)
00379 {
00380   if (q == NULL)
00381     return NULL;
00382   pq_elm_p nextp = q->first;
00383   pq_elm_p p;
00384   while (nextp != NULL)
00385     {
00386       p = nextp; nextp = p->next;
00387       free (p);
00388       if (nextp == q->last)
00389         {
00390           if (nextp != q->first)
00391             free (nextp); /* beware: already freed if last == first */
00392           nextp = NULL;
00393         }
00394     }
00395   free (q);
00396   return NULL;
00397 }
00398 
00399 static pq_elm_p make_pq_elm (page_p pg)
00400 {
00401   pq_elm_p p = (pq_elm_p) malloc (sizeof (pq_elm));
00402   p->page = pg;
00403   pg->qelm = p;
00404   return p;
00405 }
00406 
00407 /* pg becomes the last in q */
00408 static void pq_insert (pqueue_p q, pq_elm_p p)
00409 {
00410   if (q->first == NULL)
00411     {                           /* q empty */
00412       p->prev = p;
00413       p->next = p;
00414       q->first = p;
00415       q->last = p;
00416     }
00417   else                          /* q not empty */
00418     {
00419       p->prev = q->last;
00420       p->next = q->first;
00421       q->first->prev = p;
00422       q->last->next = p;
00423       q->last = p;
00424     }
00425   q->len++;
00426   return;
00427 }
00428 
00429 static void pq_remove (pqueue_p q, pq_elm_p p)
00430 {
00431   if (q->len <= 1)
00432     {                           /* only one element in q */
00433       q->first = NULL;
00434       q->last = NULL;
00435       q->len = 0;
00436     }
00437   else
00438     {
00439       p->next->prev = p->prev;
00440       p->prev->next = p->next;
00441       if (p == q->first)
00442         q->first = p->next;
00443       if (p == q->last)
00444         q->last = p->prev;
00445       q->len--;
00446     }
00447   return;
00448 }
00449 
00450 static void pq_enqueue (pqueue_p q, page_p pg)
00451 {
00452   if ( q == NULL || pg == NULL)
00453     {
00454       put_msg (ERROR, "pq_enqueue: NULL pqueue or page.\n");
00455       return;
00456     }
00457   return pq_insert (q, make_pq_elm (pg));
00458 }
00459 
00460 /* pg is moved to the last in the LRF queue */
00461 static void pq_touch (page_p pg)
00462 {
00463   if (pg == NULL)
00464     {
00465       put_msg (WARN, "touching NULL page.\n");
00466       return;
00467     }
00468   pq_elm_p p = pg->qelm;
00469   if (p == NULL)
00470     {      
00471     put_msg (WARN, "touching NULL qelm.\n");
00472     return;
00473     }
00474 
00475   pqueue_p q = pg->pinned ? q_pinned : q_unpinned; 
00476   if (p == q->last)
00477     return;
00478   pq_remove (q, p);
00479   pq_insert (q, p);
00480   return;
00481 }
00482 
00483 /* remove the first in q */
00484 static page_p pq_dequeue_unpinned ()
00485 {
00486   if (q_unpinned->first == NULL)
00487       return NULL;
00488 
00489   pq_elm_p p = q_unpinned->first;
00490   page_p pg = p->page;
00491   pq_remove (q_unpinned, p);
00492   free (p);
00493   return pg;
00494 }
00495 
00496 static page_p pq_dequeue_pinned ()
00497 {
00498   if (q_pinned->first == NULL)
00499       return NULL;
00500 
00501   pq_elm_p p = q_pinned->first;
00502   page_p pg = p->page;
00503   unpin (pg);
00504   pq_remove (q_unpinned, p);
00505   free (p);
00506   return pg;
00507 }
00508 
00509 /* pg truns into pinned, move it to another queue */
00510 static void pq_turn_pinned (page_p pg)
00511 {
00512   if (pg->pinned)
00513     return;
00514   pq_elm_p p = pg->qelm;
00515   pq_remove (q_unpinned, p);
00516   pq_insert (q_pinned, p);
00517   return;
00518 }
00519 
00520 /* pg turns into unpinned, move it to another queue */
00521 static void pq_turn_unpinned (page_p pg)
00522 {
00523   if (!pg->pinned)
00524     return;
00525   pq_elm_p p = pg->qelm;
00526   pq_remove (q_pinned, p);
00527   pq_insert (q_unpinned, p);
00528   return;
00529 }
00530 
00531 /* Search the global file_handles[] to see if the file
00532    is already open and returns its position in file_handles[].
00533    Returns -1 if the file is not open.
00534 */
00535 static int find_fhandle_i ( const char *fname )
00536 {
00537   int i, num_compared;
00538   for ( i = 0, num_compared = 0; num_compared < num_file_handles; i++ )
00539     {
00540       if ( file_handles[i] != NULL )
00541         {
00542           if ( strcmp (file_handles[i]->fname, fname) == 0)
00543             return i;
00544           num_compared++;
00545         }
00546     }
00547   return -1;
00548 }
00549 
00550 /* Search the global file_handles[] for an empty slot,
00551    to be used to store a new file handle.
00552    Returns -1 if there is no empty slot (the number of
00553    open files has reached MAX_OPEN_FILES).
00554 */
00555 static int get_empty_fhandle_i ()
00556 {
00557   int i;
00558   for ( i = 0; i < MAX_OPEN_FILES; i++)
00559     if ( file_handles[i] == NULL)
00560       return i;
00561   return -1;
00562 }
00563 
00564 static fhandle_p make_fhandle ( const char *fname, int fd )
00565 {
00566   fhandle_p fh = (fhandle_p) malloc (sizeof (file_handle_struct));
00567   fh->fname = (char *) malloc (strlen (fname) + 1);
00568   strcpy (fh->fname, fname);
00569   fh->fd = fd;
00570   fh->num_blocks = lseek (fd, (off_t) 0, SEEK_END) / BLOCK_SIZE;
00571   fh->current_block = NULL;
00572   int i;
00573   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00574     {
00575       fh->blocks_in_mem[i] = NULL;
00576     }
00577   return fh;
00578 }
00579 
00580 static fhandle_p get_tbl_file ( const char *fname )
00581 {
00582   int file_i = find_fhandle_i (fname);
00583         
00584   if ( file_i == -1 )
00585     return NULL;
00586 
00587   return file_handles[file_i];
00588 }
00589 
00596 static fhandle_p get_or_open_tbl_file ( const char *fname )
00597 {       
00598   fhandle_p fh = get_tbl_file (fname);
00599 
00600   if ( fh != NULL )
00601     return fh;
00602 
00603   if ( num_file_handles == MAX_OPEN_FILES )
00604     {
00605       put_msg (WARN,
00606                "Cannot open file %s because the limit %d of open files has reached.",
00607                fname, MAX_OPEN_FILES);
00608       return NULL;
00609     }
00610 
00611   int fd = open (fname, O_RDWR, 0);
00612   if ( fd == -1 )
00613     {
00614       /* if the file does not exist, create one */
00615       ;
00616       if ( (fd = creat (fname, 0600)) == -1 )
00617         {
00618           put_msg (WARN,
00619                    "Failed to create file %s.", fname);
00620           return NULL;
00621         }
00622 
00623       /* close and open the created file again for read and write */
00624       if (close (fd) == -1 || (fd = open (fname, O_RDWR, 0)) == -1)
00625         return NULL;
00626     }
00627 
00628   int empty_i = get_empty_fhandle_i ();
00629   if ( empty_i == -1 )
00630     return NULL;
00631         
00632   fh = make_fhandle (fname, fd);
00633         
00634   file_handles[empty_i] = fh;
00635   num_file_handles++;
00636         
00637   return fh;
00638 }
00639 
00640 /* forward declaration */
00641 static void release_block ( block_p b );
00642 
00643 static int close_tbl_file ( fhandle_p fhandle )
00644 {
00645   if (fhandle == NULL)
00646     return -1;
00647   int i;
00648   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00649     {
00650       if ( fhandle->blocks_in_mem[i] == NULL)
00651         continue;
00652       release_block ( fhandle->blocks_in_mem[i] );
00653     }
00654   if ( close (fhandle->fd) == 0)
00655     {
00656       int file_i = find_fhandle_i (fhandle->fname);
00657       free (fhandle->fname);
00658       free (fhandle);
00659       file_handles[file_i] = NULL;
00660       num_file_handles--;
00661       return 0;
00662     }
00663   return -1;
00664 }
00665 
00666 int close_file ( const char *fname )
00667 {
00668   int i = find_fhandle_i (fname);
00669   if (i != -1)
00670     close_tbl_file (file_handles[i]);
00671   return i;
00672 }
00673 
00674 int pager_init ( void )
00675 {
00676   num_file_handles = 0;
00677         
00678   /* global vars file_handles[] are initialized with NULL.
00679      in case they are not, or pager_init is called again
00680      after pager_terminate, initialize them anyway */
00681   int i;
00682   for ( i = 0; i < MAX_OPEN_FILES; i++)
00683     file_handles[i] = NULL;
00684   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00685     {
00686       pages[i] = make_page (i);
00687       if ( pages[i] == NULL )
00688         {
00689           put_msg (ERROR, "pager_init failed");
00690           pager_terminate ();
00691           return -1;
00692         }
00693     }
00694   q_pinned = make_pqueue ();
00695   q_unpinned = make_pqueue ();
00696   pager_profiler_reset ();
00697   return 0;
00698 }
00699 
00700 static block_p get_buffered_blk_in_fhandle ( fhandle_p fh, int bnr)
00701 {
00702   int i;
00703   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00704     {
00705       if ( fh->blocks_in_mem[i] == NULL)
00706         continue;
00707       if ( fh->blocks_in_mem[i]->blk_nr == bnr )
00708         {
00709           pq_touch (fh->blocks_in_mem[i]->page);
00710           return fh->blocks_in_mem[i];
00711         }
00712     }
00713   return NULL;
00714 }
00715 
00716 static int set_blk_in_fhandle ( fhandle_p fh, block_p b )
00717 {
00718   int i;
00719   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00720     {
00721       if ( fh->blocks_in_mem[i] == NULL)
00722         {
00723           fh->blocks_in_mem[i] = b;
00724           return i;
00725         }
00726     }
00727   put_msg (ERROR, "set_blk_in_fhandle: fails.\n");
00728   return -1;
00729 }
00730 
00731 static void remove_blk_from_fhandle ( block_p b )
00732 {
00733   int i;
00734   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00735     {
00736       if ( b->fhandle->blocks_in_mem[i] == b)
00737         {
00738           b->fhandle->blocks_in_mem[i] = NULL;
00739           return;
00740         }
00741     }
00742 }
00743 
00744 static int same_block ( block_p b1, block_p b2 )
00745 {
00746   if ( b1 == NULL || b2 == NULL )
00747     return 0;
00748   return ((strcmp (b1->fhandle->fname, b2->fhandle->fname) == 0)
00749           && (b1->blk_nr == b2->blk_nr));
00750 }
00751 
00752 static int is_last_block ( block_p b )
00753 {
00754   return ( b->blk_nr == b->fhandle->num_blocks - 1 );
00755 }
00756 
00757 int eof ( page_p p )
00758 {
00759   return ( is_last_block (p->block) && eob(p) );
00760 }
00761 
00763 static void release_block ( block_p b )
00764 {
00765   if (b == NULL) return;
00766   if (b->page->pinned)
00767     unpin (b->page);
00768   remove_blk_from_fhandle (b);
00769   b->page->block = NULL;
00770   free (b);
00771 }
00772 
00773 void pager_terminate ( void )
00774 {
00775   int i;
00776   /* put_pqueues_info (DEBUG); */
00777   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00778     {
00779       if (pages[i] == NULL)
00780         continue;
00781       release_block (pages[i]->block);
00782       free (pages[i]);
00783       pages[i] = NULL;
00784     }
00785   for ( i = 0; i < MAX_OPEN_FILES; i++)
00786     close_tbl_file ( file_handles[i]  );
00787   q_unpinned = release_pqueue (q_unpinned);
00788   q_pinned = release_pqueue (q_pinned);
00789 }
00790 
00791 /* Find an available buffer page, in this order:
00792    - unused page,
00793    - unpinned page,
00794    - unpin a pinned page.
00795 */
00796 static page_p available_page ()
00797 {
00798   /* put_pqueues_info (DEBUG); */
00799   page_p pg;
00800   int i;
00801   /* First, get an unused page */
00802   if ( q_pinned->len + q_unpinned->len < NUM_PAGES)
00803     {
00804       for ( i = 0; pages[i]->block != NULL; i++);
00805       pg = pages[i];
00806     }
00807   else
00808     {
00809       /* put_msg (DEBUG, "available_page: all pages are used.\n"); */
00810       pg = pq_dequeue_unpinned (); /* replace an unpinned page */
00811       if (pg == NULL)
00812         /* put_msg (DEBUG, "available_page: all pages are pinned.\n"); */
00813         /* If all pages are pinned, unpin the first page
00814            and get that one.
00815            This is of course a bad page replacement strategy. */
00816         pg = pq_dequeue_pinned ();
00817 
00818       release_block (pg->block);
00819       init_page (pg, pg->page_nr);
00820     }   
00821   pq_enqueue (q_unpinned, pg);
00822   return pg;
00823 }
00824 
00825 /* Returns the buffer page (position in pages[]) of the block).
00826    If the block does not have a buffer page allocated, allocate one.
00827 */
00828 static page_p page_for_block ( block_p b )
00829 {
00830   if ( b == NULL )
00831     return NULL;
00832   int i;
00833   for ( i = 0; i < NUM_PAGES; i++)
00834     {
00835       if (pages[i] == NULL)
00836         continue;
00837       if ( same_block (pages[i]->block, b) )
00838         return pages[i];
00839     }
00840   /* put_msg (WARN, "block %d not in mem yet, allocate an available one.\n", b->blk_nr); */
00841   return available_page ();
00842 }
00843 
00844 page_p get_page ( const char *fname, int blknr )
00845 {
00846   fhandle_p fh = get_or_open_tbl_file (fname);
00847   block_p blk = NULL;
00848 
00849   if (fh == NULL)
00850     {
00851       put_msg (ERROR, "get_page: NULL fh.\n");
00852       return NULL;
00853     }
00854 
00855   if ( blknr == -1 )
00856     blknr = fh->num_blocks == 0 ? 0 : fh->num_blocks - 1;
00857 
00858   if ( blknr < 0 || blknr > fh->num_blocks )
00859     {
00860       put_msg (ERROR, "get_page: block nr %d out of ragne [0,%d].",
00861                blknr, fh->num_blocks);
00862       return NULL;
00863     }
00864   else if ( fh->current_block != NULL && blknr == fh->current_block->blk_nr )
00865     blk = fh->current_block;
00866   else if ( blknr == fh->num_blocks )
00867     fh->num_blocks++;
00868   else  
00869     blk = get_buffered_blk_in_fhandle ( fh, blknr );
00870 
00871   if ( blk == NULL )
00872     {
00873       blk = (block_p) malloc (sizeof (block_struct));
00874       blk->fhandle = fh;
00875       blk->blk_nr = blknr;
00876       if (pin ( blk ) == NULL)
00877         {
00878           remove_blk_from_fhandle (blk);
00879           free (blk);
00880           return NULL;
00881         }
00882       set_blk_in_fhandle ( fh, blk );
00883       blk->page->current_pos = PAGE_HEADER_SIZE;
00884     }
00885   /* put_msg (DEBUG, "get_page: blk %d, page %d\n",
00886      blk->blk_nr, blk->page->page_nr); */
00887   fh->current_block = blk;
00888   return blk->page;
00889 }
00890 
00891 page_p get_page_for_append ( const char *fname )
00892 {
00893   page_p pg = get_page (fname, -1);
00894   if ( pg == NULL )
00895     return NULL;
00896   pg->current_pos = pg->free_pos;
00897   return pg;
00898 }
00899 
00900 page_p get_next_page ( page_p p )
00901 {
00902   int blk_nr = is_last_block (p->block) ?
00903     p->block->fhandle->num_blocks : p->block->blk_nr + 1; 
00904   return get_page (p->block->fhandle->fname, blk_nr);
00905 }
00906 
00907 void page_set_pos_begin ( page_p p )
00908   {
00909     if ( p == NULL ) return;
00910     p->current_pos = PAGE_HEADER_SIZE;
00911   }
00912 
00913 page_p pin ( block_p b )
00914 {
00915   if ( b == NULL )
00916     return NULL;
00917   page_p pg = page_for_block (b);
00918 
00919   b->page = pg;
00920   pq_turn_pinned (pg);
00921   pg->block = b;
00922   pg->pinned = 1;
00923   if ( read_page (pg) < 0 )
00924     {
00925       put_msg (ERROR, "read_page %d fails\n", pg->page_nr);
00926       return NULL;              
00927     }
00928   return pg;
00929 }
00930 
00931 void unpin ( page_p pg )
00932 {
00933   pq_turn_unpinned (pg);
00934   pg->pinned = 0;
00935   if ( pg->dirty != 0 )
00936     write_page(pg);
00937 }
00938 
00939 int read_page (page_p p)
00940 {
00941   if ( p == NULL )
00942     {
00943       put_msg (ERROR, "read_page: NULL page.\n");
00944       return -1;
00945     }
00946   if ( p->dirty != 0 )
00947     return 1;
00948   if ( p->block == NULL )
00949     {
00950       put_msg (ERROR, "read_page: NULL block.\n");
00951       return -1;
00952     }
00953   if ( p->block->fhandle == NULL )
00954     {
00955       put_msg (ERROR, "read_page: NULL fhandle.\n");
00956       return -1;
00957     }
00958   int fd = p->block->fhandle->fd;
00959   if (lseek (fd, (off_t) BLOCK_SIZE * p->block->blk_nr, SEEK_SET) < 0)
00960     {
00961       put_msg (ERROR, "read_page: lseek to fd %d offset %ld fails.\n",
00962                fd, BLOCK_SIZE * p->block->blk_nr);
00963       return -1;
00964     }
00965   int bytes_read = read (fd, p->content, BLOCK_SIZE);
00966   if ( bytes_read == -1) return -1;
00967   if ( bytes_read == 0 )
00968     set_page_free_pos ( p, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE );
00969   else
00970     {
00971       inc_num_reads (fd, p->block->blk_nr);
00972       check_page_header_size (p);
00973       set_page_free_pos_from_content (p);
00974     }
00975   return 0;
00976 }
00977 
00978 int write_page (page_p p)
00979 {
00980   if ( p == NULL )
00981     {
00982       put_msg (ERROR, "write_page: NULL page.\n");
00983       return -1;
00984     }
00985   if ( p->dirty == 0 )
00986     return (0);
00987   if ( p->block == NULL )
00988     return -1;
00989   if ( p->block->fhandle == NULL )
00990     return -1;
00991   int fd = p->block->fhandle->fd;
00992         
00993   if (lseek (fd, (off_t) BLOCK_SIZE * p->block->blk_nr, SEEK_SET) < 0)
00994     return -1;
00995   inc_num_writes (fd, p->block->blk_nr);
00996   p->dirty = 0;
00997   return write (fd, p->content, BLOCK_SIZE);
00998 }
00999 
01000 int page_block_nr (page_p p)
01001 {
01002   if ( p == NULL )
01003     {
01004       put_msg (ERROR, "page_block_nr: NULL page.\n");
01005       return -1;
01006     }
01007   return p->block->blk_nr;
01008 }
01009 
01010 int page_current_pos (page_p p)
01011 {
01012   if ( p == NULL )
01013     {
01014       put_msg (ERROR, "page_current_pos: NULL page.\n");
01015       return -1;
01016     }
01017   return p->current_pos;
01018 }
01019 
01020 int page_set_current_pos (page_p p, int pos)
01021 {
01022   if ( p == NULL )
01023     {
01024       put_msg (ERROR, "page_set_current_pos: NULL page.\n");
01025       return -1;
01026     }
01027   p->current_pos = pos;
01028   return p->current_pos;
01029 }
01030 
01031 
01032 int page_valid_pos_for_get ( page_p p, int offset )
01033 {
01034   if (offset >= PAGE_HEADER_SIZE && offset < p->free_pos)
01035     return 1;
01036   put_msg (WARN,
01037            "page_valid_pos_for_get: page: %d, offset %d out of range [%ld,%ld]\n",
01038            p->page_nr, offset, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE, (p->free_pos) - 1 );
01039   return 0;
01040 }
01041 
01042 int page_valid_pos_for_put ( page_p p, int offset, int len )
01043 {
01044   if (offset >= PAGE_HEADER_SIZE && offset <= p->free_pos
01045       && offset <= BLOCK_SIZE - len)
01046     return 1;
01047   /* put_msg (WARN, */
01048   /*       "page_valid_pos_for_put: offset %d out of range [%ld,%ld]\n", */
01049   /*       offset, PAGE_HEADER_SIZE, */
01050   /*       p->free_pos > (BLOCK_SIZE - len) ? p->free_pos : (BLOCK_SIZE - len)); */
01051   return 0;
01052 }
01053 
01056 static int set_pos_after_put ( page_p p, int offset )
01057 {
01058   if (offset > p->free_pos)
01059     {
01060       set_page_free_pos (p, offset);
01061     }
01062   p->current_pos = offset;
01063   return 0;
01064 }
01065 
01066 int eob ( page_p p )
01067 {
01068   return (p->current_pos >= p->free_pos);
01069 }
01070 
01071 int page_get_int ( page_p p )
01072 {
01073   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_get (p, p->current_pos) )
01074     {
01075       put_msg (FATAL, "page_get_int\n");
01076       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01077     }
01078   int res = (int) *((int *)((p->content) + p->current_pos));
01079   p->current_pos += INT_SIZE;
01080   return res;
01081 }
01082 
01083 int page_put_int ( page_p p, int val )
01084 {
01085   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_put (p, p->current_pos, INT_SIZE) )
01086     {
01087       return -1;
01088     }
01089   memcpy ( p->content + p->current_pos, (char *) &val, INT_SIZE );
01090   p->dirty = 1;
01091   set_pos_after_put ( p, p->current_pos + INT_SIZE );
01092   return 0;
01093 }
01094 
01095 int page_get_int_at ( page_p p, int offset )
01096 {
01097   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_get (p, offset) )
01098     {
01099       put_msg (FATAL, "page_get_int_at\n");
01100       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01101     }
01102   int res = (int) *((int *)((p->content) + offset));
01103   p->current_pos += INT_SIZE;
01104   return res;
01105 }
01106 
01107 int page_put_int_at ( page_p p, int offset, int val )
01108 {
01109   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_put (p, offset, INT_SIZE) )
01110     {
01111       return -1;
01112     }
01113   memcpy ( p->content + offset, (char *) &val, INT_SIZE );
01114   p->dirty = 1;
01115   set_pos_after_put ( p, offset + INT_SIZE );
01116   return 0;
01117 }
01118 
01119 
01120 int page_get_str ( page_p p, char *str, int len )
01121 {
01122   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_get (p, p->current_pos) )
01123     {
01124       put_msg (FATAL, "page_get_str\n");
01125       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01126     }
01127   strncpy ( str, p->content + p->current_pos, len );
01128   p->current_pos += len;
01129   return 0;
01130 }
01131 
01132 int page_put_str ( page_p p, char *str, int len )
01133 {
01134   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_put (p, p->current_pos, len) )
01135     {
01136       return -1;
01137     }
01138   strncpy ( p->content + p->current_pos, str, len );
01139   p->dirty = 1;
01140   set_pos_after_put ( p, p->current_pos + len );
01141   return 0;
01142 }
01143 
01144 int page_get_str_at ( page_p p, int offset, char *str, int len )
01145 {
01146   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_get (p, offset) )
01147     {
01148       put_msg (FATAL, "page_get_str_at\n");
01149       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01150     }
01151   strncpy ( str, p->content + offset, len );
01152   p->current_pos += len;
01153   return 0;
01154 }
01155 
01156 int page_put_str_at ( page_p p, int offset, char *str, int len )
01157 {
01158   if ( !page_valid_pos_for_put (p, offset, len) )
01159     {
01160       return -1;
01161     }
01162   strncpy ( p->content + offset, str, len );
01163   p->dirty = 1;
01164   set_pos_after_put ( p, offset + len );
01165   return 0;
01166 }
